review_title: Beware of the Predator in the Tutor Center
pros: None , because they protect sexual predators.
cons: Stay away from the UCA tutor center that is upstairs in the library. There is a very sick individual working evenings there. They have been notified, reports etc., still they do nothing. This person is very good at being a predator and hides in plain sight. They act like a good caring person. They are not. Beware.

review_title: Great mission, low pay, no opportunities for growth
pros: Fantastic benefits, paid time off, tuition remission, and retirement contribution. Beautiful campus. Robust employee wellness program. Free access to fitness and recreation center. Very focused on student success.
cons: Very low pay and no COLA despite 9% inflation! There is a very transparent effort to shrink the workforce. This means critical positions are going unfilled or being eliminated altogether, causing the employees that remain to do the work of 2-3 positions without additional compensation. This is leading to record levels of burnout and employee turnover.

review_title: Great opportunities if you seek them!
pros: Wonderful school with lots of potential, small school + small town = great work life balance. If you are looking for opportunities to teach, broaden the minds of students, or help serve students in some capacity, this is the place to be.
cons: The only negative thing I have to say about working at UCA is the lack of communication. I hope that in the near future things get better in this arena, but the lack of communication between departments and employees can be avoided if you are proactive, if not, then it probably still won't diminish your experience too much. It's just a cultural norm to be silo'd, but if that doesn't bother you, then this school is awesome! :)

pros: As a residential assistant, I was able to develop my leadership skills, communication skills, and teamwork skills. As an RA, I had to work with different individuals with personalities that were vastly different from my own. Because of this position, I was able to get a better understanding that not everyone I encounter nor will everyone I work with do things as I would.
cons: As an RA I was always on duty, not just during my assigned duty days. Some of the residents I was in charge of had difficulty obeying the rules and following proper residential hall protocol. This made it difficult to relate to them and get them interact with me.

review_title: Some Divisions Are Better Than Others
pros: You will receive a lot of benefits: wellness benefits, free access to the gym, discounts to performances, reduced co-pay for visiting the Health Center, free counseling...the list goes on.
cons: If you are a professor, you pretty much have free reign over your time. If you are professional staff, how much flexibility you have depends on the division for which you work. Some supervisors are sticklers about every second you're supposed to be on the clock. Also, UCA provides the lowest pay in the state for certain types of non-teaching opportunities.

review_title: UCA Center for writing and communication
pros: I am a student at UCA and I work part-time as a tutor for the Center for Writing and Communication. Working here has been great, especially as a full-time student. The pay is fair, and the center directors are kind and helpful.
cons: The only bad thing is that you aren't able to work over most of the breaks, so it's helpful to either save your money or pickup a seasonal job during the winter and spring for extra cash during these times.

pros: The location is great. Conway is located thirty five to forty minutes from Little Rock. If you live in Little Rock and work in Conway, you will be driving against traffic and should not run into any delays, unless of course there happens to be an accident. Conway is also a growing community with great schools should you decide to live in Conway.
cons: The biggest problem was the availability, of lack of, parking. Depending on what time you arrive, you might need to allow an additional fifteen or twenty minutes just to find a parting spot. I do believe that the university is trying to address this issue.

review_title: Working for UCA  is the best decision I've ever made!!
pros: The University has some of the best staff in the country. The atmosphere overall is very conducive to learning, and it is really exiciting to see the students eager to learn. The deans and administrators are very supportive, the campus is beautiful and the student enrollment increases every year.
cons: Some of the downsides of working for The University of Central Arkansas are the fact that it is in Conway and not as close to Little Rock, as one would like. That being said because it is a bit of a distance away from Little Rock, the crime rate is lower.

pros: It's a state job so you get a good 401k, 8 hours of vacation and sick time per month when starting. Great environment: overall local community of Conway Arkansas is a great place to live.
cons: Salaries tend to stay at entry level for a very long time, advancement only happens if you move from job to job by applying for new positions. It is very rare to advance in your own department without years and years of dedicated service. Faculty positions are very much the same with slow advancement in pay.

review_title: The University of Central Arkansas is a good place for some people to work, but not for others.
pros: UCA offers tuitiion reimbursement, so you can continue your education.  They have some great Masters level and PhD level programs.  The workout facility is nice and the campus is beautiful.
cons: UCA is a challenging place for minorities.  Also, you are often required to work a huge amount of overtime without being compensated.

review_title: Working at the Student Center felt like being part of a family.
job_title: Computer Support Specialist in Conway, AR
pros:
I was given the freedom to use my own ideas to solve tasks.
Everyone works together to accomplish tasks.
Leadership truly cares about their employees.
Hours are flexible to accommodate studies.
cons: Chic-Fil-A and Pizza Hut are downstairs (Student Center), which makes eating healthy difficult. This could also be seen as a Pro.

pros: Great value for student-athletes, very good administration that helps and actually wants student-athletes to graduate with a degree and not just play sports taking just enough classes to be NCAA eligible like some schools
cons: Sort of in the middle of nowhere and there are limited opportunities and some of the teams are not very good but most are top in the conference

pros: It was great to work with students and have a positive impact in their lives. The beautiful campus was well maintained and provided a lovely backdrop.
cons: There were numerous leadership issues - still are. Silos exist everywhere. To be successful, one has to learn to work among the many closed groups.

job_title: IT Specialist Student Worker in Conway, AR
pros: Learned a lot about troubleshooting computers and gives me need experience before I graduate.  Great college compared to others I've been too.
cons: You can not expect much as a student worker.  I really don't have any complaints except that the students you work with are young and not self motivated.

review_title: I work in one of the best departments with great faculty and staff.
pros: The students. And every day I learn something new.
cons: The upper administration makes sure they give 5hemselves very healthy raises every year. Faculty make considerably less than average compared to other schools it's size. And many staff live in poverty.

cons: Less than competitive pay. Hiring based more on who you know than competency, making some departments critical to students' success sub par at best.

pros: I thoroughly enjoyed working as a student worker at UCA. Keep in mind, though, that this was a federal work study position. This job allowed me to work during school and was never too much stress. The people I worked with are wonderful and I still keep in touch with them today.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: The people working there care about all facets of the university.  All departments work together to complete tasks and enjoy what they are doing.
cons: Some of the downsides of working at the University of Central Arkansas would include: funds are not very plentiful and some workers are older and not trying to advance in their field.
